Key Match Events: Bello pitched eight innings of two-hit ball on Wednesday night to lead the Boston Red Sox to a 3-0 victory over the Toronto Blue Jays.
Tyler O'Neill hit a two-run homer off reliever Brendon Little in the eighth to make it 3-0.
Wilyer Abreu's single gave the Red Sox the lead in the first inning.
Masataka Yoshida had a three hits, and Kenley Jansen pitched a perfect ninth for his 25th save.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Boston has beaten Toronto in two straight after being swept in (most of) a doubleheader on Monday.
Chris Bassitt allowed one run on five hits and a walk, striking out nine before leaving with two outs in the seventh inning down just 1-0.
Toronto RHP Bowden Francis (7-3) will face Boston's Kutter Crawford (8-11) in the series finale Thursday.
